intro: Tibouchina brevisepala, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tibouchina, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple bracteate flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Tibouchina brevisepala thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
